content: mini mittens i had so much fun making my mini boots and stockings that i thought i would make some mini mittens too and yes my fingers were ironically cold in this photo they are knit in the round in one piece on dpns but instead of bobble toes like the stockings they have bobble thumbs the ends are used to tidy them up and then hidden inside they also make the cord that runs between the mittens so they can hang on your tree i used worsted but for even tinier mittens you could use fingering or sock enjoy and stay warm copyright 2025 by natasha hanson all rights reserved 1 finished measurements height 1 /2 5cm yarn i use patons classic worsted but you can push the limits of tiny and use sock or fingering needles one set of double-pointed needles dpns in size us 2 2 75mm or desired size pattern notes 2 stitch bobble knit into the front of the next stitch then the back turning 1 stitch into 2 turn knitting and p2 turn knitting and k2 repeat these two row one more time with right side facing pass 2nd stitch on the right needle over the 1st now you are back to your original stitch count video links bobbles 3 ways how to use dpns in the round how to do a yarn over bind-off abbreviations k = knit kfb = knit front and back 1 st increase mb= make 2 st bobble st s = stitch es mitten instructions using your mitten color cast on 6 sts divide the sts over 2 dpns 3 sts on both needle 1 & 2 and join to work in the round round 1-3 knit round 4 kfb k5 7 sts round 5 mb k6 pull first st after bobble tight cut yarn about 6 /15cm change to top white color round 6 knit do a yarn over bind-off see video link when you cut the yarn make one of your mitten s cast off end long enough for a cord to connect the mittens for the non-cord mitten hide the end inside and trim carefully for the cord mitten leave the end out for later finishing now we deal with the two top ends where you changed color i use my main color end to tidy up my bobble thumb by sewing a st or two through the bottom of it which cinches it together basically i try and make it more thumb like the white end gets hidden inside and trimmed and so does the cast on end take your longer cast off end to make the cord that runs between them and then knot it to the other mitten s cuff i like to attach mine to the middle of their cuffs which means i have to weave it over to the middle first before i attach it hide it inside and trim carefully for pattern support just pm me always happy to help
